title: Belief revision by examples
abstract: A common assumption in belief revision is that the reliability of the information sources is either given, derived from temporal information, or the same for all. This article does not describe a new semantics for integration but the problem of obtaining the reliability of the sources given the result of a previous merging. As an example, the relative reliability of two sensors can be assessed given some certain observation, and allows for subsequent mergings of data coming from them.
